sentence.Network_en: People expect others to be honest, which is why conmen find it so easy to hoodwink people.
sentence.Network_cn: 人们认为别人是诚实正直的，所以骗子很容易行骗得逞。

sentence.Network_en: He could hoodwink him all right.
I cannot believe that so blatant a comedy can hoodwink anybody.
sentence.Network_cn: 我无法相信这么显眼的一出喜剧能够欺骗谁.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (originally in the sense to blindfold): from the noun hood + an obsolete sense of wink 'close the eyes'

entry.def: If someone hoodwinks you, they trick or deceive you.

example.ex: People expect others to be honest, which is why conmen find it so easy to hoodwink people...
example.tran: 人们认为别人是诚实正直的，所以骗子很容易行骗得逞。

example.ex: Many people are hoodwinked by the so-called beauty industry.
example.tran: 很多人都被所谓的美容业欺骗了。

means.word_mean: 2. conceal one's true motives from especially by elaborately feigning good intentions so as to gain an end;

sentences.sentence: "He bamboozled his professors into thinking that he knew the subject well"
